conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces visible, interior volume is readable, and ceiling/roof is removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear floor-wall separation and readable corner geometry; clean cutaway with minor simplification in some wall junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core layout (bedroom-left, living/dining-center, kitchen-right, toilet near center/top) largely matches, but utility space and balcony from the 2D plan are not clearly represented; some partitions/door placements appear simplified vs plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present (bed, sofa, kitchen counters/appliances, toilet/sink). Scales generally plausible; some rooms (utility/balcony) lack corresponding elements.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good lighting and materials; however, visible text labels on the floor reduce presentation cleanliness, and some openings (doors/windows) are not fully clear.

detected_errors.description: Utility area and balcony shown in the 2D plan are missing or not clearly modeled in the 3D render, reducing layout fidelity.
Door/window placement and opening proportions appear simplified and may not match the 2D plan exactly.
Text labels are visible on the 3D floor surface, reducing presentation quality.

summary: A genuine and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong depth cues, but with notable layout omissions (utility/balcony) and some simplified openings versus the 2D plan.
